crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
Data stored to a users PHP SESSION via the invocation of setSessionParam() can subsequently be extracted through getSessionParam(). Due to the fact that the CRNRSTN Suite :: uses a system of checksums and encryption to handle storage and retrieval of PHP SESSION data, information that was not pushed into SESSION via the session_manager :: class with its appropriate methods will not be able to be accessed through the invocation of the same.
Because the mcrypt ciphers require the data targeted for encryption to be of string data type, certain data types including objects, arrays, boolean will be stored in SESSION just as it was received...sans encryption. Integers, float (or double) and...of course...string data types are able to be processed by the mcrypt ciphers.
crnrstn_element.crnrstn_returnedvalue: The SESSION value of the $name parameter.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.

Because the mcrypt ciphers require the data targeted for encryption to be of string data type, certain data types including objects, arrays, boolean will be stored in SESSION just as it was received...sans encryption.
Currently tested on an ubuntu 4.2 server running PHP Version 5.2.6 and Apache 2.2.11

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: The name of the parameter that is to be stored in the PHP SESSION.
